103.heading: Dunster-Whiting, Joseph.
103.title: "Reality Character and Comics"
103.author: Joseph Dunster-Whiting
103.appears_in: p. 31-35 in The Harvard Journal of Pictorial Fiction (Spring 1974)
notes: SUMMARY: "A review of the artist's stance towards fictional and 'actual' reality, using Sherlock Holmes, Ingmar Bergman, and Betty Boop (among others) as reference points, leading to an assessment of the current status of comics' literary narration. The peculiar brand of 'wisecracking narration' comes under analysis."
